thing-type.label: PIR Motion Sensor v2.5 Z-Wave Motion Sensor
thing-type.description: Z-Wave Motion Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<strong&gtOverview:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThis is a hardware revision update to EcoLink's prior PIR sensor. It provides the same general capabilities as the prior detector--motion detection, battery state messages, and "burgler" alarm for the case being opened. On motion detection a green LED will flash and the notification will be sent to Group 1.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtAssociation Groups:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThe device has two association groups of up to 5 nodes each.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtConfiguration Parameters:</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThe device has two configuration parameters. Parameter 1 configures the sensor to send or not send Basic Set commands of 0x00 to nodes in Association group 2 turning the devices off when the sensor is in a restored state (i.e. motion not detected). By default the sensor does NOT send Basic Set commands of 0x00. Paremter 2 configures the sensor to either send or not to send Sensor Binary Report commands to Association Group 1 when the sensor is faulted and restored. If the controller is fully compatible with the Notification Command Class thereby making the Sensor Binary Reports redundant, the controller can disable the Sensor Binary Report Commands completely.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtInitial device inclusion is started by removing the pull tab from the back of the unit. This connects the battery and the device will immediately be eligible for inclusion. Place your controller in inclusion mode prior to pulling the tab from the back.</p&gt <p&gtThe manual indicates network-wide inclusion is supported, but also indicates that the device should be within 15 feet of the controller during the inclusion process.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtRemove the battery for at least 5 seconds</li&gt <li&gtReinstall the battery</li&gt <li&gtReplace the sensor cover.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtOpen, then close the sensor case.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Send Basic Sets
parameter.description: Send or do not send Basic Set commands to AG2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter 1 configures the sensor to send or not send Basic Set commands of 0x00 to nodes in Association group 2 turning the devices off when the sensor is in a restored state (i.e. motion not detected). By default the sensor does NOT send Basic Set commands of 0x00.</p&gt <p&gtConfiguration Value: 0x00:</p&gt <p&gt(Default) Sensor does NOT send Basic Sets to Node IDs in Association Group 2 when the sensor is restored (i.e. Motion Not Detected)</p&gt <p&gtConfiguration Value: 0xFF:</p&gt <p&gtSensor sends Basic Sets of 0x00 to nodes in Association Group2 when sensor is restored</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Send Binary Reports
parameter.description: Send Sensor Binary Reports for backward compatibility<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParemter 2 configures the sensor to either send or not to send Sensor Binary Report commands to Association Group 1 when the sensor is faulted and restored. If the controller is fully compatible with the Notification Command Class thereby making the Sensor Binary Reports redundant, the controller can disable the Sensor Binary Report Commands completely.</p&gt <p&gtConfiguration Value: 0x00:</p&gt <p&gt(Default) Sensor sends Sensor Binary Reports when sensor is faulted and restored for backwards compatibility in addition to Notification Reports.</p&gt <p&gtConfiguration Value: 0xFF:</p&gt <p&gtSensor will send only Notification Reports and NOT Sensor Binary Reports when the sensor is faulted and restored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Group 1
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtGroup 1 is a lifeline group who will receive unsolicited messages relating to motion detection notifications, case tampering notifications, low-battery notifications, and snsor binary reports.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Group 2
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtGroup 2 is intended for devices that are to be controlled i.e. turned on or off (on only by default) with a Basic Set. On inclusion the controller should put its node ID in group 1 but not in group 2.</p&gt
